de.eckhartarnold.client

Class TiledLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.eckhartarnold.client.Layout
      • de.eckhartarnold.client.FullScreenLayout
        • de.eckhartarnold.client.TiledLayout

  • public class TiledLayout
extends FullScreenLayout
    Defines a "tiled" layout.

    A tiled layout consists of three blocks, namely, the image panel ("I"), the control panel ("P") and the caption ("C"), of which the image panel is obligatory while the other two are optional. These three blocks can be arranged almost horizontally and vertically in an almost arbitrary manner, with possible horizontal delimiting lines (html "

    " tags) in between. However, layouts where the image panel is arranged together with another element horizontally may not work very well. But putting the control panel next to the caption on top and the image panel below for example works quite well.
    Author:
    ecki

    • Constructor Detail

      • TiledLayout

        public TiledLayout(ImageCollectionInfo collection,
           java.lang.String configuration)
        Creates a tiled layout. The configuration string indicates the arrangement of the components "image" (represented by 'I'), "control panel" (represented by 'P') and "caption" (represented by 'C') and optional horizontal lines (represented by "-"). Components bracketed in squared brackets are arranged horizontally. Without squared brackets components are arranged vertically. Example: "[CP]-I" means that the caption and control panel are on top and the control panel is placed to the right of the caption. Below follows a horizontal separator and than the image panel.
        Parameters:
        collection - the information about the image collection
        configuration - the configuration string.

      • TiledLayout

        public TiledLayout(ImageCollectionInfo collection)
        Creates a tiled layout with the configuration: "[CP]I".
        Parameters:
        collection - the information about the image collection

    • Method Detail

      • getRootWidget

        public Widget getRootWidget()
        Description copied from class: Layout
        Returns the root widget of the layout. The widget can be inserted anywhere in a web site. After attaching the root widget to the web site, method issueResize should be called to make sure that the layout's size is adjusted properly.
        Overrides:
        getRootWidget in class FullScreenLayout
        Returns:
        the root widget of the layout

      • initOverlayWidgets

        protected void initOverlayWidgets(ImageCollectionInfo info)
        Description copied from class: FullScreenLayout
        Initializes the overlay objects. This method is meant to be overridden by descendant classes which do not really need overlay objects by an empty method.
        Overrides:
        initOverlayWidgets in class FullScreenLayout
